content: संगम् {c1c} <ab>A.</ab> {@--1@} To come or join together, meet, encounter; अक्षधूर्तैः समगंसि <ls>Dk.</ls>; एते भगवत्यौ कलिंदकन्यामंदाकिन्यौ संगच्छेते <ls>A. R. 7.</ls> {@--2@} To cohabit, have sexual intercourse with; भार्या च परसंगता <ls>Pt. 1. 238</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 378.</ls> {@--3@} To keep company or intercourse with, associate with. {@--4@} To agree, harmonize, be suitable. {@--5@} To become contracted, shrink up. {@--6@} To die, depart. {@--7@} To go to, attain (with <ab>acc.</ab>). {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To bring together, join, unite; वधूवरौ संगमयांचकार <ls>R. 7. 20.</ls> {@--2@} To endow or present with, unite with, bestow on, give to; प्रियसुहृदि बिभीषणे संगमय्य श्रियं वैरिणः <ls>R. 12. 104.</ls>
